rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Web stresses in an all-welded plate girder.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: At a time when the price of rolled and fabricated steel has risen to all-time new highs and the availability of such material is limited, it is easily understood why it is necessary to re-examine designs which a few years ago were safe, but conservative, to see if today they cannot be made safe and economical. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An experimental study of position and object discrimination in the dog.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This paper reports an investigation of visual position and object discrimination in the dog. For over sixty years, psychologists have been studying sensory discrimination in animals. The capacities for visual perception of a great many species have been investigated, and numerous careful and detailed studies have been published [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology, Comparative.
Dogs -- Psychology.
Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Beta ray spectra of neutron deficient isotopes of antimony and tellurium.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The energies available in the McGill cyclotron enable one to investigate by means of (p,xn) reactions, neutron deficient isotopes lying far below the line of stability of the elements. This thesis is concerned with investigations of (p,xn) reactions on antimony. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The fading of radio echoes from the ionosphere.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The fading of a single echo reflected from the ionosphere has been investigated experimentally by periodic sampling of amplitude variations at spaced receivers, for one year. Regular time displacements in the fading records have been measured and analysed and have been found to be consistent with assumed horizontal motion of irregularities in the ionosphere. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the taste of enzymatic digests of proteins.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Proteins are essential in human nutrition. Many circumstances arise, however, where the needs of the body are not satisfied by the normal dietary intake. Hypoproteinemia may occur where there is impairment of the function of some body organ, such as the liver, kidneys or alimentary tract. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A group therapy experiment with withdrawn children.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis is designed to describe a project in group therapy with boys between the ages of twelve and fourteen years who were known by psychiatrists as "withdrawn" children. The project was undertaken as an experiment. Since there were many indications of positive results, the project was also to be used for the purpose of demonstrating group therapy with this particular group of boys. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of certain plant growth regulating substances on early yield and quality of field grown tomatoes.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The tomato, Lycopersicon esculentum L., a native fruit of tropicalical America, is one of our most pop1lar vegetables. It ranks next to the potato and sweet potato in total value and first among the perishable vegetables, Thompson (1949). It is grown by a large percentage of market gardeners and truck growers and is the leading canning crop. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Horticulture-Botany.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An analysis of discussions of a radio series promoting mental health.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study is concerned with the way in which one radio listener group used the material in the mental health series entitled "In Search of Ourselves." This series was presented by the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation as one form of mental health education. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Experiments on the pulping of periodate lignin by the sulfite process.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The removal of the lignin portion of wood for the production of pulp, particularly for the manufacture of high grade paper and rayons has in the past century become of increasing technological interest. Although a considerable number of processes are known, probably the sulfite process has been the most investigated. The complexity of the structure of wood as a whole, and the lignin portion in particular has led to a large number of divergent views on the chemistry of this process. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The geology of the Lake Wasa property, Beauchastel township, Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The purpose of this thesis is to describe, in detail, the geology of the Lake Wasa Mining Corporation property in Beauchastel township, Quebec, with particular emphasis on a petrographic and mineragraphic study of selected drill cores from both surface and underground drilling on the property. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Factors affecting the metabolism of acetylcholine in tissue suspensions.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The function of the nervous system is the control and coordination of the various activities of the body. Not only do nerves initiate or modify the specific functions of organs, but they also seem to control the sensitivity of organs in regard to directly attacking stimuli. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The impact of international prices on the New Zealand economy.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In any study of the New Zealand economy today it is essential that the major feautures of her historical and geographical background be reviewed. The international ties brought about by her comparatively short history and the implications of her position in the South Pacific, both from the standpoint of climate and comparative isolation, have a vital part in the understanding of New Zealand today. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: New Zealand -- Economic conditions.
Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Family allowances in Canada : a discussion of the social, economic, and political considerations which led to the passage of the Family Allowances Act of 1944 and a description and analysis of its administration.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A substantial quantity of literature exists which portrays Canadian legislative and administrative processes in general terms. The object of this study is to examine and assess the political, social, and economic considerations which led to the passage by Parliament of a particular Act and to describe in detail the manner in which it is administered. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Family allowances -- Canada.
Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Biochemical investigations of snake venoms in relation to their neurotoxic effects.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Venoms are complex mixtures of pharmacologically very active components, many of which have been shown to be proteins having enzymic activities. They are powerful toxins to man and animals and as such have aroused the interest of investigators in various fields from early times. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect on pressure surges of pipeline termination.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The fact that a water hammer blow effect is experienced in an enclosed line when the water flow is stopped has been well known to engineers from as long ago as the 17th Century. However, until comparatively recent years, there has been no record of any attempt to solve the problem directly. The most common approach has been that of "solution by avoidance of the difficulty". [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The resonance characteristics of certain transmission-Line circuits.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It has long been known that the propagation of radio-frequency power along an open-wire transmission line leads inevitably to some spurious radiation. In the case of a resonant transmission line this radiation seriously affects the Q or selectivity of the circuit. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On Dirac’s Classical theory of the radiating electron.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Ever since the discovery of the electron in 1897, the problem of its structure has been the subject of considerable investigation. No conspicuous success has yet been achieved, though, with the increasing study of high-energy phenomena and the development of quantam electrodynamics, the problem has become of great importance. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Changes in the perception of tachistoscopically presented incomplete figures, in patients receiving electric convulsive therapy.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Ten patients and eleven controls received three equivalent tests before, during, and after ECT, or a similar lapse of time. The tests involved the tachistoscopic presentation of Street's Gestalt Figures; the number correctly recognized being the score used. Conclusions reached are: (1) A significant drop is found in learning and remembering the test material, (2) No cumulative affect of the number of convulsions is seen on test performance, and (3) A convulsion tends to produce the greatest drop when it occurs before reproduction rather than before learning. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychotherapy.
Psychology.
Psychology -- Mental tests.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Psychiatric problems of unmarried mothers.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In considering the studies which have been made of unmarried mothers, it is noteworthy that the emphasis has been primarly in the field of child welfare. Relatively few studies have been undertaken of those unmarried mothers who because of either individual problems of adjustment, or their inability to plan adequately for their children have sought psychiatric help. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies of gastric secretion.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Gastric secretion has been studied by many investigators since the pioneer days of Pavlov. The control and regulation of gastric secretiob has been the subject of intense study. The results of previous work have shown that the gastric glands are controlled by a variety of regulating mechanisms. The main features being the nervous control by parasympathetic nervous system, the mechanical and hormonal factors in the stomach itself. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: State and fiscal monopolies (the state entrepreneur).
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Two phenomena give particular emphasis to problems of Public Finance, and make necessary a thorough analytical treatment of the subject. They are: 1. The increase of public expenditures; 2. The increase and expansion of the entrepreneurial activities of the state. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Monoplies.
Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An investigation of the facilitatory and inhibitory activity of the suprabulbar regions of the cat.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It is not difficult to conceive of physiological conditions in mammalian life requiring an immediate and generalized augmentation of neuro-muscular activity, with or without an accompanying increase in mental activity. Fear, excitement, pain, and rage, are all examples of situations which cause unusual emphasis to be placed on the ability of the individual to develop a rapid and widespread increase in all muscular forces. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Neurology and Neurosurgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Climate and architecture : with special reference to Montreal and surroundings.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Actually, the architect has been a climatologist much longer than being an expert or the other disciplines above. Very rarely does one see mention made of this role of the architect. Little training in this line is given the university student. This, therefore, is the object of this thesis: To acquaint architects and architectural students, particularly those in the Montreal area, with the demands and phenomena of the large and small scale climate, known respectively as the macroclimate and microclimate; and to inform them how to apply this knowledge to the design and orientation of buildings and towns. It is not the object to discuss the use of different materials, and their weathering qualities, except in a general sense. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Architecture and climate.
Architecture.
Architecture and climate -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The McDougall-Segur conglomerate.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Since the beginning of geological investigation of the Rocky Mountain Geosyncline (1) in southwest Alberta and in southeast British Columbia, the problem of the origin of the lower cretaceous sediments has repeatedly arisen. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.
Geology -- Alberta.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Helminth parasites of Catostomus commersonii in the Quebec area.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Many writers, including Cameron (1938), and Linton (1897) have shown the necessity of studying the parasites of freshwater fishes. Cameron (1938) pointed out, that Canada, with its one-eighth million square miles of freshwater, has an extremely valuable population of commercial and game fish which harbour parasites of both medical and veterinary importance. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Parasitology.
